landing.descriptionText: Learn to set goals and stay on track.

gates.descriptionText: Add at least 1 goal to your profile
gates.descriptionAltText: Add at least 1 goal to your profile

exercises.titleText: How to Set Goals
exercises.subtitleText: See how Dax learns to set goals.

config.completeSubtitleText: See how Dax learns to set goals.

speechBubbles.bubbleText: “They watched in horror as the doorknob slowly began to turn—”<hr/>BEEP BEEP BEEP! The sound of Dax’s stopwatch trilled, interrupting her story.<hr/>“Gotta go!” Dax was off in a flash, running towards the park. Marsh and Pep were left sitting on the bench staring after her, stunned by her sudden exit.

“What’s the rush?” Marsh asked finally, annoyed by the abrupt ending to the scary story.<hr/>“Cartwheel practice!” remembered Pep. “Dax is trying to learn to do a perfect cartwheel.”<hr/>Pep knew how badly Dax wanted to compete in the Olympics one day. “Learning to cartwheel is a key skill for a gymnast, so it's a really important goal.”

Suddenly Pep jumped up, pointing in Dax's direction. “Do you see that? I think Dax is being followed!”<hr/>Marsh shrugged. “It just looks like clouds of dust to me.”<hr/>But Pep knew better. <hr/>“Clean your glasses, Marsh. That’s a whole grapple of goal gremlins!”

Marsh blinked at Pep. “Goal gremlins? A grapple? Please explain.”<hr/>Pep told Marsh how goal gremlins are tricksters who want to derail anyone working to meet a goal. They can appear in many forms and are hard to spot. But when you do spot them they lose a lot of their power.”

Pep suspected that the first gremlin to go after Dax would be the Muddler.
“This gremlin likes to strike early, when a goal is just getting set,” Pep explained. “It tries to stop you from setting a clear goal. It’s mucky and makes your goal feel hazy and hard to achieve.”
“Aw, nerts!” whispered Marsh, worrying about Dax.

“Then there's the Distractor,” Pep continued. “Its tactic is to lure you away from your goal.”
“This gremlin will try to tempt you with all kinds of distractions.”
“Sneaky!” Marsh squeaked.

“The Swarm of Excuses is the peskiest gremlin,” Pep went on.
“It can descend on you with all kinds of reasons why you won’t be able to reach your goal.”
“This gremlin wants to frustrate you. Even worse, it can chip away at your self-confidence.”
“Annoying!” muttered Marsh.

“Next, watch out for the Procrastinator,” said Pep.
“Procrasta-what?“ asked Marsh.
Pep described a sly, charming gremlin that wants goal-setters to think they have all the time in the world.
“It will try to delay you from working towards your goal!” warned Pep.

“Finally, there’s the creepiest gremlin of all: Vampiro,” Pep whispered.
“Double nerts.” Marsh whimpered.
“It doesn't drink blood,” said Pep quickly. “But Vampiro tries to drain your motivation for your goal. It wants you to stop thinking about why your goal matters.”

“Pep, we can't let these gremlins ruin Dax's goal. Or she’ll never reach her Olympic dream!“ Marsh said as they set off to find their friend.<hr/>By the time they reached Dax, she was surrounded. “This is more serious than I thought,” said Pep. “Dax’s goal means so much to her, it’s made these gremlins extra greedy.”<hr/>“Courage!” cried Marsh. “It's time to start gremlin-busting!”

speechBubble.bubbleText: Strange... I know I want to be a gymnast, but how do I start?
Strange... I know I want to be a gymnast, but how do I start?
Dax is getting muddled already! Help clear things up.
Dax is getting muddled already! Help clear things up.

landing.descriptionText: Identify what you need to set a goal.
landing.descriptionAltText: Identify what you need to set a goal.

hub.titleText: Watch out, the Muddler is making its move on Dax!
hub.descriptionText: Stop this gremlin before it makes a mess of her goal.

exercises.titleText: Pick the key goal-setting step:

options.shortText: Pick the same goal as your friend
options.answerText: Hmm...you might not always have the same goals as your friend.

options.shortText: Choose a clear and realistic goal
options.answerText: Yep! Challenge yourself within your limits.

options.shortText: Just start doing something and pick your goal later
options.answerText: Hmm...don't think that's the best way to set a goal.

options.shortText: Pick a goal that will make you famous
options.answerText: Hmm...not sure that's key to goal setting.

exercises.titleText: Pick the key goal-setting step:

options.shortText: Decide on a finish line for your goal
options.answerText: Exactly! Pick a timeframe to aim for.

options.shortText: It’s better not to give your goal a finish line
options.answerText: Hmm...pretty sure a finish line is an important step.

options.shortText: Once you set a finish line you can’t change it
options.answerText: Hmm...most of the time your finish line can change.

options.shortText: Always set your finish line on a special occasion
options.answerText: Hmm...not always—it depends on your goal.

exercises.titleText: Pick the key goal-setting step:

options.shortText: Don't make a plan to reach your goal
options.answerText: Hmm...pretty sure every goal needs a plan.

options.shortText: Break your goal down into smaller steps
options.answerText: Right! Breaking your goal into steps gives you a plan.

options.shortText: Complete your goal as quickly as possible
options.answerText: Hmm...some goals need more time to complete than others.

options.shortText: Skip over any steps that are too hard
options.answerText: Hmm...skipping a hard step won't get you closer to your goal.

exercises.titleText: Pick the key goal-setting step:

options.shortText: Think about why your goal matters to your teacher
options.answerText: Hmm...not all your goals will concern your teacher.

options.shortText: Dwell on all the ways you could fail to reach your goal
options.answerText: Hmm...don't think this would be a useful action.

options.shortText: Reflect on why your goal matters to you
options.answerText: That’s it! This will help you stay motivated along the way.

options.shortText: Don’t think about your goal, it’s bad luck
options.answerText: Hmm...not sure luck matters here.

summary.titleText: Here are some key goal-setting steps:

image.subTitleText: Dax scrubbed the Muddler by getting clear on her goal: to learn to do a perfect cartwheel.

speechBubble.bubbleText: More goal gremlins are closing in!
Help Dax defeat these sneaky new gremlins.
Help Dax defeat these sneaky new gremlins.

landing.descriptionText: Spot some goal setting obstacles and ways to overcome them.
landing.descriptionAltText: Spot some goal setting obstacles and ways to overcome them.

hub.titleText: More gremlins are circling the park!
hub.descriptionText: Help Dax spot them and shoo them away in the next mission.

exercises.titleText: The Distractor is closing in! What could distract someone from reading 1 chapter book in a month?
exercises.questionText: Goal: Reading 1 chapter book in a month

options.shortText: Starting a new video game
options.answerText: Got it! Might be too tempting to spend time playing instead of reading.

options.shortText: Setting aside a certain time to read each day
options.answerText: Hmm...this sounds like a good plan, not a distraction.

options.shortText: Planning to read at least 5 pages a day
options.answerText: Hmm...pretty sure this is a good idea and not a distraction.

options.shortText: Reading with a friend 2 days a week
options.answerText: Hmm...seems like this could be one way to reach that goal.

exercises.titleText: It’s the Swarm of Excuses! What poor excuse could stop someone from practicing tennis 3 times a week?
exercises.questionText: Goal: Practicing tennis 3 times a week

options.shortText: The tennis court is closed for repairs
options.answerText: Hmm...sounds like something you can't control—not a poor excuse.

options.shortText: I sprained my ankle so I should rest until I feel better
options.answerText: Hmm...that's a good reason to take a break.

options.shortText: There’s no point in practicing at all unless I practice every day
options.answerText: Yep! 3 practices a week is way better than none.

options.shortText: There's a class trip today so I’ll practice on the weekend instead
options.answerText: Hmm...sounds like a wise plan rather than a poor excuse.

exercises.titleText: Here comes the Procrastinator! What could keep someone from leaving for school on time?
exercises.questionText: Goal: Leave for school on time

options.shortText: Pack their school bag before bed
options.answerText: Hmm...pretty sure that would help leaving for school on time.

options.shortText: Watch just 1 more cartoon episode
options.answerText: You bet! The extra screen time can lead to being late.

options.shortText: Get out of bed as soon as they wake up
options.answerText: Hmm...pretty sure that would help someone leave on time.

options.shortText: Wait until after school to get out the Lego
options.answerText: Hmm...sounds like a good idea if they want to leave on time.

exercises.titleText: STEP UP!
exercises.subTitleText: Now help Dax defeat the gremlins and keep her goal on track!

exercises.titleText: Dax needs to practice. Pick 2 ways Dax can defeat the Distractor
exercises.questionText: 2 ways Dax can defeat the Distractor

options.shortText: Her goal must not truly matter if she gets distracted
options.answerText: Hmm...distractions can get in the way of all goals.

options.shortText: Stay away from distracting things while she cartwheels
options.answerText: Excellent move!

options.shortText: Set a certain time to work on cartwheels and take short breaks
options.answerText: Right on! Short breaks can help Dax focus without distractions.

options.shortText: Give in to the distraction so it stops bothering her
options.answerText: Hmm...pretty sure that's letting the Distractor win.

exercises.titleText: Pick 2 ways Dax can stop the Swarm of Excuses from pulling her off track
exercises.questionText: 2 ways Dax can stop the Swarm of Excuses from pulling her off track

options.shortText: Ignore the excuses and do her cartwheel practice
options.answerText: Great idea! Most excuses will fade away without the attention.

options.shortText: Wear earmuffs so she can’t hear the excuses
options.answerText: Hmm...pretty sure earmuffs will only help keep her ears warm.

options.shortText: Listen to the excuses and give up on cartwheeling
options.answerText: Hmm...pretty sure that's letting the Swarm of Excuses win.

options.shortText: Think about her Olympic dream to drown out any excuses
options.answerText: Nice plan! Thinking of her long-term goal is an excuse-buster.

exercises.titleText: Pick 2 ways that Dax can outsmart the Procrastinator and meet her goal on time.
exercises.questionText: 2 ways that Dax can face down the Procrastinator

options.shortText: Plan to skip cartwheeling today but do extra the next time
options.answerText: Hmm...skipping practice for no reason can pull Dax's goal off track.

options.shortText: Keep track of each practice, like with a sticker on a calendar
options.answerText: Fantastic! Seeing her progress, she won’t want to skip practice.

options.shortText: If she puts it off today, her cartwheels will be better tomorrow
options.answerText: Hmm...don't think her cartwheels will get better without practice.

options.shortText: Plan to cartwheel at a certain time, like right after lunch
options.answerText: Yes! That’s a good way to stay on track and beat procrastination.

image.subTitleText: Dax shook off those pesky gremlins and made some good progress.

summary.titleText: Here are some obstacles to goals and ways to overcome them:

speechBubble.bubbleText: Don’t let Vampiro steal Dax’s will to ‘wheel!
Don’t let Vampiro steal Dax’s will to ‘wheel!
I'm tired of cartwheeling. Why am I trying so hard?
I'm tired of cartwheeling. Why am I trying so hard?

speechBubble.bubbleText: That was my best cartwheel yet! The crowd goes wild! Sounds kinda like you, Marsh.

landing.descriptionText: See how goals can help dreams come true.
landing.descriptionAltText: See how goals can help dreams come true.

hub.titleText: You sent those goal gremlins scurrying!
hub.descriptionText: Help more Xellions set goals for big dreams in this final mission.

exercises.titleText: Pick the goal that could help Treble's dream come true.

characterPrompt.text: My dream is to play the piano for big audiences.

options.shortText: Learn to play the guitar
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

options.shortText: Play 1 song on the piano in a school concert
options.answerText: Yes! Treble could get comfy playing in front of an audience.

options.shortText: Write a chapter book
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

exercises.titleText: Pick the goal that could help Atlas' dream come true.

characterPrompt.text: My dream is to sail on a boat around the world.

options.shortText: Take a course about water safety
options.answerText: Got it! Being safe on the water is an important step towards Atlas’ dream.

options.shortText: Learn to dive from the highest diving board
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

options.shortText: Learn how to surf
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

exercises.titleText: Pick the goal that could help Chip's dream come true.

characterPrompt.text: My dream is to make an app for a phone or a tablet.

options.shortText: Do soccer drills 3 times a week
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

options.shortText: Use coding games to learn the basics of computer programs
options.answerText: Don't give up!

options.shortText: Get accepted to cooking school
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

exercises.titleText: Pick the goal that could help Dart's dream come true.

characterPrompt.text: My dream is to get a job looking after animals.

options.shortText: Start a pet-sitting service for friends and neighbours
options.answerText: Absolutely! That’s a great way for Dart to get started towards his dream.

options.shortText: Take a babysitting course
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

options.shortText: Learn to fish
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

exercises.titleText: Pick the goal that could help Newt's dream come true.

characterPrompt.text: My dream is to help people who are sick.

options.shortText: Pick up litter in the schoolyard every week
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

options.shortText: Draw cartoons for the school paper
options.answerText: Hmm...try again.

options.shortText: Interview the school nurse about their job
options.answerText: Super! Newt can find out if she might like a job as a nurse.

summary.titleText: Here are some goals to help certain dreams come true:

image.subTitleText: You and Dax are ready to shine at goal setting and getting.

speechBubbles.bubbleText: “Way to battle those sneaky gremlins!” gushed Marsh, as he gave Dax a high five.<hr/>“They were a sneaky bunch.” Dax agreed. “Thanks for the help fending them off. It’s weird but I think my cartwheels got better after all that!”<hr/>“Maybe facing gremlins makes you stronger,” Marsh’s eyes grew wide, “like when you eat spinach! Maybe gremlins are spinach for goals?!”

“One thing’s for sure,” Pep assured Dax, “if those gremlins show up again, you’ll know how to tackle them.”<hr/>“My stomach’s growling. Let's go for smoothies,” Dax suggested. “Oh! And I can pick up my scary story where I left off.”<hr/>“No thanks!” said Marsh quickly, still recovering from the gremlin invasion. “How about a funny story, instead? One with lots of cute bunnies and kittens.”

summary.descriptionText: You faced the mission challenges and persevered like a pro!
